Detailed Description

Class that handles the window.

Creates and allows manipulation to the window and coordinate system.

Member Function Documentation

double Window::bottomCoord (  ) 

Get the bottom coordinate of the current coordinate system.

Returns:
double The bottom y value of the current cooridnate system.

void Window::endFrame (  ) 

Used to indicate the end of the frame.

This is used to calculate the framerate. Do to this we must specify the start and end each frame. This will indicate the end.

unsigned int Window::getFrameRate (  ) 

Get the framerate of the program at that time.

Returns:
unsigned int The current framerate of the program.

double Window::leftCoord (  ) 

Get the left coordinate of the current coordinate system.

Returns:
double The left x value of the current cooridnate system.

void Window::release (  ) 

Releases the instance of the Window object obtained.

Release the instance of the Window obtained from getInstance(). This must be called on the pointer obtained from getInstance() to ensure that no memory leaks occur and that the Window object is destroyed when nobody has an instance of the object.

double Window::rightCoord (  ) 

Get the right coordinate of the current coordinate system.

Returns:
double The right x value of the current cooridnate system.

void Window::setCoord ( double  left,
double  right,
double  bot,
double  top 
)

Sets the coordinate system to the given values.

Parameters:
left The left x coordinate of the system.
right The right x coordinate of the system.
bot The bottom y coordinate of the system.
top The top y coordinate of the system.

void Window::startFrame (  ) 

Used to indicate the start of the frame.

This is used to calculate the framerate. Do to this we must specify the start and end each frame. This will indicate the start.

double Window::timeSinceLastFrame (  ) 

Gets the number of seconds that have passed during the last frame.

Returns:
double The number of seconds passed during the last frame. Will usually be below the value of 1.0.

double Window::topCoord (  ) 

Get the top coordinate of the current coordinate system.

Returns:
double The top y value of the current cooridnate system.

void Window::zoomCoord ( double  xPercentage,
double  yPercetange 
)

Zooms in the coordinate system by the given percentages.

Parameters:
xPercentage What percentage of the current x coordinate size desired. A value of 1.0 means 100% the size of the current x coordinate size which does nothing. 0.5 means half the size (zooming in) of the current x coordinate size. 2.0 means twice the size (zooming out) of the current x coordinate size.
yPercentage What percentage of the current y coordinate size desired. A value of 1.0 means 100% the size of the current y coordinate size which does nothing. 0.5 means half the size (zooming in) of the current y coordinate size. 2.0 means twice the size (zooming out) of the current y coordinate size.
